language, biology, mathematics consisting of or containing a single part, structure, etc.: A parent with such a single dose of the dominant allele is called the simplex parent.
electronics of a communications system, allowing communication in only one direction: Radio technology refers to a simplex system when only one party can transmit at a time.
More examplesFewer examplesJones (1991) tested first graders on the segmentation of morphophonologically complex and simplex forms in English.Many of these studies observe that despite their semantic, structural, and pragmatic complexity, diminutives are one of the earliest, morphosyntactic form to be acquired, with both simplex and diminutized forms appearing in the speech of very young children. The simplex algorithm was used to minimize the mean-squared error between these data sets.The 3816 laser printer prints in both simplex (front side only) and duplex (both sides) modes.Data transmission flow: circuits are: Simplex: one direction; Half duplex : two directions, only one at a time; Full duplex: two directions simultaneously.

language a simple word that is not a combination of other words or parts of words : Several Old English simplices have the general meaning "mind".
mathematics the simplest shape that is possible in a particular space : A regular simplex of dimension n is the polytope with the largest number of points that can be embedded in Rn such that all points are equidistant.
More examplesFewer examplesThis difference in the usage of compounds and simplexes in verse is illustrated quite concisely by a comparison of their average distributions.A d-polytope is simplicial if every proper face is a simplex.
